title: Motion & Kinematics Practice Exam
description: Test your understanding of motion and kinematic equations

questions.question: A car accelerates from rest at $2 \text{ m/s}^2$. What is its velocity after 5 seconds?
A ball is thrown upward with an initial velocity of $20 \text{ m/s}$. Using $g = 10 \text{ m/s}^2$, what is the maximum height reached?
questions.explanation: At maximum height, $v_f = 0$. Using $v_f^2 = v_i^2 + 2a\Delta x$ with $a = -10 \text{ m/s}^2$: $0 = (20)^2 + 2(-10)\Delta x$, so $\Delta x = \frac{400}{20} = 20 \text{ m}$

questions.question: An object with constant velocity has zero acceleration.
questions.explanation: Acceleration is the rate of change of velocity. If velocity is constant, it doesn't change, so $a = 0$.

questions.question: A train moving at $15 \text{ m/s}$ accelerates uniformly to $25 \text{ m/s}$ over a distance of 100 m. What is the acceleration?
The slope of a velocity-time graph represents _______.
questions.explanation: The slope of a velocity-time graph is $\frac{\Delta v}{\Delta t}$, which is the definition of acceleration.

questions.question: An object is dropped from rest and falls for 3 seconds. How far does it fall? (Use $g = 10 \text{ m/s}^2$)
questions.explanation: Using $\Delta x = v_i t + \frac{1}{2}at^2$ with $v_i = 0$: $\Delta x = 0 + \frac{1}{2}(10)(3)^2 = 5(9) = 45 \text{ m}$

questions.question: Displacement and distance are always equal in magnitude.
questions.explanation: Displacement is the straight-line distance from start to finish, while distance is the total path length. They are only equal for straight-line motion in one direction.

questions.question: A cyclist traveling at $12 \text{ m/s}$ applies brakes with a deceleration of $3 \text{ m/s}^2$. Calculate the time taken to stop.
questions.explanation: Using $v_f = v_i + at$: $0 = 12 + (-3)t$, so $3t = 12$ and $t = 4 \text{ s}$
